question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: If the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). Given this, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The question about Donald Trump resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The question about Joe Biden resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Given this, will Joe Biden announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: For the condition, Donald Trump must not be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. For the outcome, Joe Biden must announce both that he is dropping out of the re-election race and that he will be resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024 (Pacific Time). The announcement is sufficient; formal resignation is not required by that date.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to the deadline, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Conditional on Chris Christie not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning any other candidate is selected. This determination is solely based on the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? The resolution criteria for this outcome are as follows:

- The question resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle.
- The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of Biden accepting the nomination.
- If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the question resolves as No.

The resolution of this question will be based on the original Metaculus question, and once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied here.

question.title: Given Malta fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Malta does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final, this condition is met.

Then, we ask: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves **No** for all other candidates.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: If Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

Given this, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024? The interview must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must be released before market close at the end of July 2024 to resolve YES. If no qualifying interview occurs, it resolves NO.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed by the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such removal or block. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on July 15, 2024, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average for July 15, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. It resolves as NO if Trump's lead is 2 or less, or greater than 3.

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate, including Donald Trump, is selected instead.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

question.title: GIVEN Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine, will it have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still count if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

Then, will "Deadpool and Wolverine" have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? This resolves YES if the movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally this weekend, and confirmation in the Hollywood press is required.

question.title: Conditional on Taylor Swift not cameoing in Deadpool and Wolverine, will it have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose Taylor Swift does not appear in the Deadpool and Wolverine movie in any role, including voice, and independent sources confirm her non-participation. Given this, will the Deadpool & Wolverine crossover movie have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie in any capacity, confirmed by independent sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Deadpool & Wolverine movie grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend and is reported by Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent) as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.title: Given Armenia fails to qualify, will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: Suppose Armenia does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning Armenia participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Given this, will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Criterion for condition: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this resolves to NO. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency, though he does not have to formally resign by then. This announcement must be made in Pacific Time. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one ballot is required, the answer is Yes. If only one ballot is required, the answer is No. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce dropping out or resigning before end of July, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. If he makes neither announcement, this condition is met.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one ballot is required, this resolves as Yes. If only one ballot is required, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: If the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball. Resolves NO if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves NO if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by ordering countries by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver, then Bronze.

question.title: Given the US fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold. Then, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold. Resolves No if Team USA wins both gold medals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: If Joe Biden is still president by the end of July, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: This question considers the following condition: Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Given this condition, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will use data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will consider the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not being president by the end of July 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
This question explores the impact of a significant political event on economic indicators: Suppose Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States.
Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.body:

These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase, will Joe Biden announce dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then, will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? This resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

If Kamala's odds do not increase, this question resolves N/A.

question.title: If Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will Joe Biden announce both dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Given this, will Joe Biden announce before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Kamala's odds of winning do not increase if her probability is ≤46.6% on the specified date and time.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both intentions before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Otherwise, resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

Then, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is determined by the selection of delegates at the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the election day.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The absence of removal or block is confirmed through the lack of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not count. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (between 26 July 2024 and 11 August 2024), injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s), and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by an agency of the State of France or a high-ranking French official.

Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves as YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare Biden unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter.

Note: Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France, injuring or killing any person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals

Then, is it true that the same nation will win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

question.title: Conditional on France not placing in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: France does not place in the Top 5 at the Olympics being held in 2024. This means that in the medal table, determined by the total number of medals and ordered by gold, silver, and bronze counts, France is not among the top 5 countries.

Given this condition, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the question resolves ambiguously.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Ireland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: 
- Ireland's qualification is confirmed if they participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- Serbia's qualification is confirmed if they participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.

question.title: Conditional on Ireland failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia qualify?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

This will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. **Outcome (Q):** Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? This resolves Yes if credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

The lead is evaluated by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead and a negative value indicating a Biden lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, credible reports will indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has resulted in the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control of the location.

Then, is it true that on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points, according to the chart reported on that date?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if the ISW map indicates Russian control of the location using the specified categories. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any categories indicating Russian control.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024. It resolves as **No** otherwise. If the condition is not met, the outcome is not evaluated.

question.title: If Russia does not control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control, such as Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other relevant categories.

Then, is it true that on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points? This is measured by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will INC form the government after the next Indian general election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will the Indian National Congress (INC) form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other outcomes resolve as NO. This applies to the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing value being ≤75k or >76k on July 21, 2024, will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is either less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Given this condition, will the Indian National Congress (INC) have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur in May 2024? This resolves as YES if the INC forms the government and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by the end of July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. This resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close. It resolves NO otherwise.

Then, is the following true? Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle. This commitment must include:
- A public statement from OpenAI or a spokesperson, indicating a new level of commitment to the principle, beyond previous statements.
- Verification by Metaculus that the commitment satisfies at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step."

Resolves YES if both conditions are met. Resolves NO otherwise. If the initial condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: Given someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
NYT reported: "It sounded like what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 3.5 would mean Trump is 3.5 points ahead of Biden.

question.title: Given no one intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No one intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, as described by the criteria where the NYT noted sounds like gunshots interrupted Trump's rally in Pennsylvania, but it resolves YES if no intentional shooting occurred by the defined criteria.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through July 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this condition as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

Then, we are interested in the following outcome: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This resolves as Yes if, before August 1, 2024, one of these events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before August 1, 2024, this resolves as No.

question.title: Conditional on Biden ceasing to be President before the end of July 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024, either by resignation, death, or any other means, except for temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

Given this condition, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, before August 1, 2024, one of these events occurs according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. Resolves NO if none of these events are reported before that date.

The resolution of this question is contingent upon the resolution of the specified condition.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any similar categories indicating Russian control?

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control of Chasiv Yar, including but not limited to Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other category created by ISW that indicates Russian control of the location?

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. Then, is it also true that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This means the winning height of the men's pole vault must be 6.04m or higher for the record to be considered broken.

question.body: Suppose the following is true: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, no athlete runs the Men's 100m race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Then, will the winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics be 6.04 meters or higher?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

If Tucker Carlson is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: Given that Francis Suarez is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?

This question combines two separate inquiries:

1. **Condition**: Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. It doesn't matter who is nominated instead.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th? This resolves as **Yes** if someone intentionally shot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump on that date. It resolves as **No** if it was an accidental discharge or ricochet.

Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
