question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for it to resolve as true. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher YoY on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This means there are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not count.

Given this condition, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023? This will be determined based on the reporting by the St. Louis Fed, where the reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?

This resolves to "Yes" if Fidesz-KDNP secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.body: This question explores the relationship between the volatility index and Nvidia's stock performance. Then, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share on any day before July 31, 2024? question.body: Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is lower or the same Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. This means the reported number for July 20, 2024 is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023. Then, will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close below $100 per share on any day before 7/31? If NVDA closes below $100 on any day before 7/31, the answer is YES, otherwise NO.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams and if the Bucks are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Milwaukee Bucks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals, as crowned by the NBA. Then is it true that the Miami Heat will also win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria:
- The Milwaukee Bucks winning means they are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA.
- The Miami Heat winning means they are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA.

Given that only one team can win the NBA Finals, if the Milwaukee Bucks win, the Miami Heat cannot win. Therefore, this question should resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the Milwaukee Bucks not winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Miami Heat win?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Miami Heat are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves as **No** if the Milwaukee Bucks do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, but the Miami Heat are not crowned champions or are eliminated from contention.

If the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: If Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition will be satisfied if Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 2 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is either less than or equal to 2 points, or greater than 4 points. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as No, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

All five individuals must be part of the same group message for a YES resolution. Reports of unnamed Democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO. If the criteria are not met before July 20th, the condition resolves NO.

The outcome resolves YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves NO if any other candidate is selected. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing Biden's early nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Criterion for condition: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 20 Democrats signing a public letter opposing Biden's early nomination, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Criterion for condition: A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, 2024. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given that Biden does not drop out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not drop out and continues the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria:

1. For the condition: The market resolves to YES if Biden does not drop out before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

2. For the outcome: The market resolves to YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for July 15, 2024, is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Finland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Serbia also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Finland qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and asks if Serbia will also qualify under the same conditions. 

Resolution criteria for Finland: Resolves YES if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Serbia: Resolves YES if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

Suppose the following is true: Finland qualifies for the Grand Final. Then, will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final?

question.title: Given Finland fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Serbia qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Finland does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means Finland participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final. Then, is it true that Serbia will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given another Democratic party presidential debate, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Given there will be no other Democratic party presidential debate, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. This resolves as YES if no such debate occurs, and NO if there is such a debate.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the specified grounds. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date, and strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final?

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. The footage must consist of at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family, specifically Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump, will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: If Joe Biden does not have a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. 

Given this condition, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This resolves YES if one of the following individuals is the nominee: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on Renew holding the most seats, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both Renew and ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, which is possible in the event of a tie. It resolves as **No** if only Renew holds the most seats and ECR does not.

Resolution criteria: The outcome is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both questions resolve as **Yes**, otherwise, if only one holds the most seats, only that one resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Given Renew does not hold the most seats, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Renew does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as Yes if Renew does not hold the most seats and No otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. 

Then, is it true that ECR will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as Yes if ECR holds the most seats and No otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Will Joe Biden remain the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition is true if Asa Hutchinson is chosen as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution.

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question considers the condition where Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that if any other candidate is selected, the condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Asa Hutchinson is not the nominee.

In this scenario, we are interested in whether Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024. Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics if Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag. This means that no more than 34 Russian athletes are competing at the 2024 Olympics. Given this situation, will Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics as described above.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Russian athletes competing at the 2024 Olympics, will Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal?
question.body:
This question explores the outcome of Sha'Carri Richardson's performance at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, given that Russian athletes are not barred from competing.

Suppose the following is true: More than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, confirming their participation. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports indicating Russian participation.

Then, is it true that Sha'Carri Richardson will win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games? This resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any event, such as the Women's 100m or the Women's 4x100m Relay, based on the schedule provided.

Resolution criteria for P: More than 34 Russian athletes must compete at the 2024 Olympics. If no more than 34 compete, or if the Olympics are canceled or postponed, P resolves as No or ambiguously.

Resolution criteria for Q: Sha'Carri Richardson must win gold in any event for Q to resolve YES.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, previously held by Bill Johnson. This will be determined based on credible sources reporting a Republican victory. If reports conflict, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20? This will be resolved by checking the source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, the answer is yes. Otherwise, the answer is no.

question.title: Given the Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th district, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person not representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. 

Then, is the following also true? Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? This resolves to Yes if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the specified source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves to No.

Resolution criteria:

- For Chris Christie, the question resolves as **Yes** if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Note: This scenario is logically inconsistent under normal circumstances, as typically only one nominee is selected by the convention. However, this question explores the logical implications if both were to be considered nominees.

question.title: Conditional on Doug Burgum not being the Republican nominee, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Doug Burgum is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any candidate other than Doug Burgum is selected.

Then, is Chris Christie selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: For Doug Burgum not being the nominee, this resolves as Yes if any candidate other than Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention. For Chris Christie being the nominee, this resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention. The questions are not restricted to currently listed candidates, and the resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces not accepting the Democratic nomination, will he die before July 26?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. This statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this scenario, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024? 

The question resolves as YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves as NO. If the condition is not met, it resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will he die before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024. 

Then, is it true that there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024?

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a statement is made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This will occur if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for the Joe Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is the following true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles posing a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above condition is met. Then, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Given a geomagnetic storm with K-index between 4 and 6 occurs between July 17-28, 2024, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

Then, will the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, depart the International Space Station (ISS) by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024? 

The Starliner must undock from the ISS and begin its return journey to Earth by this deadline. The resolution will be based on official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, or a consensus of credible reporting.

question.title: Given the strongest geomagnetic storm K-index is <=4 or >6 between July 17-28, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 4 or greater than 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. 

Then, will the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, depart the International Space Station (ISS) by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024?

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.
