question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This resolves Yes if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves No.

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve Yes if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. Furthermore, this status is as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

Then is it true that Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it is solely about who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Trump is not removed from any primary ballot, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This means there are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal or block. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements do not count, and the question does not consider legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

Given this situation, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Suarez is chosen as the nominee and NO otherwise, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Conditional on 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, this condition is true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

Context: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.), offers the first public signal from Democrats that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

question.title: Given fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. This means that if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then this condition is met. 

Then, is it true that at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: In a Manifold poll comparison, Donald Trump gains at least 3% more votes when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by comparing two specific polls that close on July 6, where the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. 

Now, given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45 minutes or more before the end of July 2024? This must be a qualifying interview, such as an appearance on a podcast or a late-night show, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, and similar events do not count. If no such interview occurs before the end of July 2024, the answer is NO.

question.title: Given Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before July 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Given that Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question explores the conditional scenario where Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Suppose this is true. Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? The question resolves **Yes** if such charges or indictments occur before this date.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two separate conditions:

1. **Condition:** Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if any candidate other than Larry Elder is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

2. **Outcome of Interest:** Donald Trump is charged or indicted for witness tampering related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. This resolves as **Yes** if such charges or indictments occur before the specified date.

Suppose the condition regarding Larry Elder is true. Then, will the outcome regarding Donald Trump also be true?

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the Republicans Party of France forming an alliance with the National Rally, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, will the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given the Republicans Party of France does not form an alliance with the National Rally, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) does not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election. This condition resolves as **Yes** if no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election by June 30, 2024, according to credible sources. If such an agreement is announced, this condition resolves as **No**.

Then, will the ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Denmark qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Azerbaijan also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Azerbaijan also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Denmark fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Azerbaijan qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Denmark does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, is it true that Azerbaijan will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This means Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the answer is No.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Austria qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Austria qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Estonia qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, is it true that Estonia will also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Conditional on Austria failing to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Austria does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Estonia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: Given someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. Resolves NO otherwise. This question will resolve the same as the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Conditional on no one intentionally shooting at Trump on July 13th, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if no one intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if there was an intentional shooting towards Trump.

Criterion for outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If such a statement is not made before the deadline, resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: If 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between FiveThirtyEight's projection of Biden as the favorite to win the US presidential election on July 19, 2024, and the resignation of Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, within the following 90 days.

Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met.

Then, we are interested in whether Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If she does, the question resolves YES; if not, it resolves NO.

question.title: If 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will the head of the Secret Service resign within 90 days?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast for July 19, as soon as July 20 data becomes available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous figures are used. 

Given this condition, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given that Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- Chris Christie is the nominee if he is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Trump is considered removed or blocked if, on July 15, 2024, he is not on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed by official announcements or credible reports. The question resolves negatively if he is not removed or blocked as of that date.

question.title: Given Chris Christie is not the Republican nominee, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Chris Christie is not selected as the Republican nominee if any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): The question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition is true if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is reported as a positive value greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Trump be removed or blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment on the same date?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves based on Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed by official state announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

Appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes can count, provided they meet the time requirement.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

This question examines the relationship between two independent political events.

**Condition:** The International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024:
- Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
- Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
- Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

**Outcome:** Joe Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this outcome.

The resolution criteria for the condition is that Maria Corina Machado is not imprisoned by the specified date, and for the outcome, the Venezuelan government must publish the full election results by the specified time.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for him to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this scenario, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before midnight July 20 Central Time? The resolution source for this is the New York Times interactive page on Biden's potential dropout: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for him to drop out, this question resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for him to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This means that there is no unambiguous and conclusive official announcement indicating that Biden would not accept the nomination.

Given this situation, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before midnight July 20 Central Time? The resolution will be based on the source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before that time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, the answer will be yes. Otherwise, the answer will be no.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given that the Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: An alliance is confirmed if an official announcement is made before June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for most seats, both resolve as Yes.

question.title: Given that Les Républicains do not form an alliance with National Rally, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) does not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election. This means that no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between Les Républicains and National Rally before June 30, 2024, according to credible sources. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will resolve as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following also true: Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it is solely about who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise.

question.title: Will Austria qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Norway qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Austria qualify as well?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Austria qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Austria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Austria participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Norway fails to qualify, will Austria qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Norway does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, then Norway fails to qualify.

Now, given this scenario, will Austria qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This means Austria must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for this to resolve as Yes. If Austria is not announced as having qualified, this resolves as No.

question.title: Given Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as **Yes** if DeSantis is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024.

The question is asking: Suppose Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee, then will Kimberly Cheatle leave her position as head of the Secret Service within the next 90 days?

question.title: Given Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?

This means any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Given this scenario, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This will be determined based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. The market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games.

Then, is the following true: The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics? This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This will be determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes win fewer than 21 gold medals before the end of the Games, this is confirmed immediately.

Then, is it true that the United States Olympic Team will win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics? This resolves to Yes if the United States wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: If the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

Then, will Biden drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If he drops out or is unable to continue before this time, the outcome will resolve to YES. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by 0.1% or less in July, will Biden drop out before July 13?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

Given this, will Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? Resolves YES if he drops out before this date and time, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before end of July 2024, will Mike Pence be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45 or more minutes before the end of July 2024. This can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but must contain at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, is it true that Mike Pence will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as selected by the Republican National Convention?

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45 or more minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., and requires at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. Then, is it true that Mike Pence will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution criteria for the outcome are based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on the day of the election.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The US Department of Commerce must officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024, for the condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. question.title: Given the US government does not end its agreement with Verisign for .com management by August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- Resolves Yes if the agreement with Verisign is not ended by the specified date.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.
- Resolves No if such a statement is not made prior to the specified date.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Given Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13th, will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this scenario, a "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or confirmed by credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

Then, is the following true: The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM? If so, this resolves YES; otherwise, NO.

Link to model: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given no Iranian military response before August 13th, will Kamala Harris's odds increase in Nate Silver's model next week?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran does not initiate any military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This means no use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, including the absence of airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions are not considered. Attacks by proxy forces will not count.

Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is greater than 46.6%, and NO otherwise. 

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: If Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for Biden dropping out: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for Trump: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Resolves "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question pertains strictly to the status as of July 15, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for Biden not dropping out: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race past July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for Trump being removed or blocked: Resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, as per 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024. Given this condition, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the 25th Amendment Section 4 is invoked as described before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise. Biden exiting the office by other means or invoking section 3 does not count.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being <= 2 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question examines the relationship between Trump's lead over Biden in the national polling average and the potential invocation of the 25th Amendment Section 4 against Biden.

**Condition:**
- Trump's lead over Biden must be either less than or equal to 2 points, or greater than 4 points, according to 538's national polling average for July 15, 2024. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

**Outcome of Interest:**
- Resolves YES if, before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President.
- The duration of the incapacity does not matter.
- Biden exiting the office by other means (e.g., death, resignation) or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.body:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.
