question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?

Resolution criteria for Sifan Hassan's medal: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Individual Neutral Athletes: This will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No". If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, it will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan not winning a medal, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Resolves NO otherwise. If the number of gold medals won by Individual Neutral Athletes is confirmed to be 21 or more before the end of the Games, the outcome resolves immediately to YES.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)* before June 1, 2024. 

Suppose the above is true. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: The market resolves to “Yes” if Biden is favored over Trump in the FiveThirtyEight forecast for July 19, 2024, and to “No” if Trump is favored. If they have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. Resolution is based on the blue and red trend lines from FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

question.title: If Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)* before June 1, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is projected as the favorite by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, meaning he has a higher probability of winning the presidential election than Donald Trump according to their forecast. Resolves NO if Donald Trump is projected as the favorite. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, the resolution is 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election (i.e., a brokered convention occurs). Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question about the brokered convention resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is required. It resolves as **No** if only one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats not having a brokered convention in 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, given that the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- Resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.
- Resolves as No if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.
- The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
- Resolves as No if such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means they are not competing under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present or credible media reports about the 2024 Olympics.

Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? This will resolve to "Yes" if they win 15 or more gold medals according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If confirmed before the end of the Games, it resolves immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

question.title: Given that Russian athletes are not barred from the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 15 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are not barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, meaning more than 34 Russian athletes compete, either under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports.

Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? This will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win 15 or more gold medals according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Norway qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Lithuania also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Lithuania also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Norway fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Lithuania qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Lithuania participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Lithuania qualifies, the question resolves as Yes. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Given an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Then, will the following be true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Given no armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 6th, 2024, there are no credible reports confirming any deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there are no credible reports of armed forces conflict deaths between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will the Democratic nominee be a woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and No if they select a male presidential nominee.

question.title: Conditional on Tucker Carlson not being the Republican nominee, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO if he is selected.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves NO if a male is selected.

question.title: Will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump is indeed selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true: Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election? This question will resolve as Yes if, in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be annulled.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as Yes -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election? This resolves as **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024. It resolves as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from major UK news sources or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
This question explores if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, given that credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition resolves as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified at the specified trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as YES if Kimberly Cheatle resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If the condition is not met, the outcome resolves as N/A.

question.title: If Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two events: Donald Trump not testifying at the hush money trial and the resignation of Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, within 90 days.

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump does not testify at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This will be confirmed if credible sources do not report his testimony, whether in person or remotely.

Then, is it true that Kimberly Cheatle will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that any other candidate is selected as the nominee. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on another Democratic party presidential debate occurring, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a Democratic debate as specified. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given there are no more Democratic party presidential debates, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There are no debates between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. This resolves as YES if no such debates occur, and NO if any such debate takes place.

Then, is Ron DeSantis selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and NO if any other candidate is selected.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: If 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris be president by the following Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is based on the probability of winning as indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website.

Given this condition, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this is official information from the US government, though a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden not as the favorite on July 19, will Kamala be president by July 26?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this is considered 50-50.

Given this situation, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used for resolution.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, one of these events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

1. The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
2. The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
3. The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
4. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given this condition, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024? Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: If no diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, none of the following events occur between the Philippines and China, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are such reports before that date, then the condition is not met.

Given this condition, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: Conditional on France placing in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between France's performance and individual athletic achievements in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

Suppose the following is true: France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

Then, is it true that an athlete will win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given that France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question explores the potential outcomes of the 2024 Paris Olympics under the condition that France does not place in the top 5 in the medal table, which is determined by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won. The question then asks if, under this condition, any athlete will win at least two medals in the sport of tennis during the same Olympics.

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI committing to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024, will ChatGPT be available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, indicating a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step." 

Then, is it true that ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? This resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for people in the EU is access without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), even if unavailable in certain countries or to minors, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

Then is it true that Kamala Harris will be nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate? The resolution is YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the resolution is NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for condition: This will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question resolves as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden will announce that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If the condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body:
Suppose Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means that Russian athletes are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag. No more than 34 Russian athletes should be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, or if the 2024 Olympics are postponed or cancelled, this condition is not met.

Given this situation, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds? This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are not barred from the 2024 Olympics, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: More than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, indicating that Russian athletes are not barred from competing. Given this condition, will any athlete run the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record? The resolution criteria for the condition are based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports. The resolution criteria for the outcome are based on results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

question.title: If Evghenia Guțul travels to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024, will the Crimean Bridge be attacked before July 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Evghenia Guțul, the governor of Gagauzia, travels to Russian territory after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, as reported by credible sources. Given this condition, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? The attack on the Crimean Bridge must be reported by credible sources and must involve weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. If the condition regarding Evghenia Guțul is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Evghenia Guțul does not travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has not traveled to Russian territory within that period. Then, is it true that after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge?

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves Yes if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves No if any other team wins or if the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Minnesota Timberwolves winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Minnesota Timberwolves win the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the Minnesota Timberwolves are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No if any other team wins or if the Timberwolves are eliminated from contention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

Note: If the condition is met (i.e., the Timberwolves win), then the outcome must resolve as No, as only one team can win the Finals.

question.title: Given the Minnesota Timberwolves do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Orlando Magic win?
question.body: The question resolves Yes if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), and the Minnesota Timberwolves do not win the 2024 NBA Finals. If the Minnesota Timberwolves win the Finals, the condition is not met, and the question resolves as N/A. It resolves No if any other team wins the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden’s chances. Behind the scenes, drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, calling on Biden to end his campaign.

This condition resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before July 20th (Pacific Time). They must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden.

The outcome resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by checking the 538's national polling average chart for that date as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is Kamala Harris nominated as the Democratic VP? This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected, it resolves to NO. The resolution can occur immediately after the nomination and is not affected by any changes after the initial nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being ≤3 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question examines the relationship between Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election and Kamala Harris's nomination as the Democratic VP.

Condition: Trump's lead over Biden is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The measurement is taken from the chart as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Resolves NO if someone else is selected. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and does not change if the VP is later replaced.

If the condition is not met, this question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 13, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Condition: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Outcome: This resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Biden does not drop out before July 13, 2024, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. Then, will he remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

question.body:

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on "Borderlands" (2024) receiving a CinemaScore of C+ or lower, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) gross over $20 million during its opening weekend?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of C+ or lower, meaning it is not well-received by audiences. This is determined by the official CinemaScore rating, and if no rating is reported, this resolves N/A.

Given this condition, we are interested in whether M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) will gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend. This is based on the "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo, typically covering the 3-day Friday-Sunday weekend plus any previews.

Resolution criteria: If "Trap" grosses more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend, this resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO. If "Borderlands" does not receive a CinemaScore, this resolves N/A.
