question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will he be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial, will he be removed or blocked from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question explores the connection between Donald Trump's participation in the hush money trial and his eligibility for primary election ballots. 

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump does not testify, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources. 

Then, is it true that by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump will have been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after that date.

"Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.

Suppose the following is true: "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) is rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release. Given this, will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above? This resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or higher, and NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Resolution criteria for "House of the Dragon" S2E7: The rating must be 8.5 or lower, based on the IMDB score two days post-release.

Resolution criteria for "Borderlands": The movie must receive a B- CinemaScore or higher. If no CinemaScore is reported, the outcome resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Prime Minister of France not being from New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics, that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s)?

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question resolves as Yes if such an attack occurs and as No if it does not.

question.title: Given the French Prime Minister is from the New Popular Front or Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to either the New Popular Front or Together coalition, according to credible sources. 

Then, will a terrorist attack occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between and including July 26, 2024 (Opening Ceremony) and August 11, 2024 (Closing Ceremony)? 

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump be the nominee?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both Asa Hutchinson and Donald Trump are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is logically impossible since only one candidate can be the nominee. Therefore, if Asa Hutchinson is the nominee, Donald Trump cannot be, and the question resolves as **No**. 

Resolution criteria: Asa Hutchinson is the nominee if selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and the same criteria apply for Donald Trump. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate besides Asa Hutchinson is selected.

Given this condition, will Donald Trump be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Asa Hutchinson is not selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It resolves as **No** if any other candidate besides Donald Trump is selected.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Given Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Between the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Given Israel refrains from a deadly attack in Iran before May 1, 2024, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and asks whether, in that case, Joe Biden will still be president of the United States by the end of July 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Resolves Yes if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves Yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolves NO otherwise.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will he have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, the FiveThirtyEight election forecast projects Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This is based on the probability indicated by the blue (Biden) and red (Trump) trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This must be a qualifying interview, such as an appearance on a podcast or late night show, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. The resolution is YES if such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, and NO if it does not.

question.title: Given 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview by end of July?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition P**: Will 538 Project Biden not as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024?
   - This resolves to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability than Trump. Resolves 50-50 if they have equal odds.
   - The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19.

2. **Outcome Q**: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
   - Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. Resolves NO if no qualifying interview is released by then.
   - Does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. Includes appearances on podcasts or shows, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

**Conditional Question**: Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight projects Donald Trump as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Given this condition, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024? This resolves as Yes if, before June 1, 2024, any of the following events occur according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events are reported before June 1, 2024, the resolution is No.

question.title: Given Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024, either by resigning, dying, or otherwise, but not due to a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment. Given this situation, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024? Specifically, this resolves as Yes if before June 1, 2024, one of the following occurs, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve based on two conditions:

Condition 1: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Condition 2: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the official selection of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of the candidates currently listed.

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if both conditions are met. If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A. If the first condition is met but the second is not, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is ≤3 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is either less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points. This is according to the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this condition, will Glenn Youngkin be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No for all other candidates. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Conditional on 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve **Yes** if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves **No**.

Suppose the following is true: 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then the condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Conditional on Iran carrying out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: After the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Given this situation, will Liz Cheney be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Then, will Liz Cheney be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Iran must not carry out an attack within Israel leading to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

Then, will Elon Musk become a guest on the official stage of Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024? The market resolves YES if Elon Musk appears as a guest on the official stage during the event.

Then is it true that Elon Musk will become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this condition, will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not announcing before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Consider the scenario where Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. Specifically, this means that by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, neither Biden nor his campaign has made a definitive, public, official announcement indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle.

Given this situation, will Tadej Pogačar be officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on the official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources?

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: If 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This is based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast, specifically the blue and red trend lines for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard will be officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, according to official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources?

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as not the favorite on July 19, 2024, will someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard will win the Tour de France 2024? The resolution of this question will be based on the official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between market volatility and the performance of the Boston Celtics in the 2024 NBA Finals.

Condition: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023. This will be determined based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

Outcome: The Boston Celtics must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA: https://www.nba.com/. If the Celtics win, the question resolves as **Yes**; if any other team wins, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Given the VXVCLS is lower or the same Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. **Condition:** The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be lower or the same on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023. This will be determined based on the reporting by the St. Louis Fed available at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome:** Resolves as **Yes** if the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals, as recognized by the NBA (https://www.nba.com/). Resolves as **No** if any other team wins.

Suppose the first condition is true: the VXVCLS is lower or the same year-over-year on July 20, 2024. Then, will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Francis Suarez is selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. It resolves as **No** if Sunak is elected as an MP for any constituency.

Sources for resolution should include credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any candidate other than Francis Suarez is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, consider the following question: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as Yes if any candidate other than Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, for any reason. Resolves as No if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. Resolution should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week, will BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM, according to the link provided (https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model). Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000? This question resolves based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, will the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Specifically, this resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then, is it true that on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX will be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. Then, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The reported number for July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, on the St. Louis Fed website.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) being the same or lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions:

1. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be the same or lower on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023. This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. The S&D must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question is: Given that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is the same or lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not related to who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders results in the death of at least five individuals, occurring after this question's publication and before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any candidate other than Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Iran will carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

question.title: Given Scotland holds an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum must have the consent of the London government and cannot be a "wildcat" style referendum. 

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but can include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

question.title: If Scotland does not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose Scotland does not hold an official and sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This includes scenarios where any referendum held does not have the consent of the London government, such as "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendums, or votes organized by civil society institutions without such consent.

Given this condition, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? This interview must involve new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person, such as on a podcast, late night show, or a segment like 60 minutes. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. The footage must be at least 45 minutes long, excluding any editing that reduces Biden's interview time below this threshold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, which includes any of the following events: The Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat from China, or China expels or recalls a diplomat from the Philippines, according to official statements or credible reports. Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? For this to resolve as Yes, Iran must execute a military action officially acknowledged by Iran or confirmed by credible reporting, excluding actions by proxy forces or cyber attacks. If the condition is not met, this resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This means that before August 1, 2024, none of the following events occur according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

Given this situation, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? For this to resolve as Yes, Iran must initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, which includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, including airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

question.title: Given Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. This announcement must be for a brand new parade and not a relocation of an existing one, such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night, to Florida. The announcement must occur between now and the end of the D23 2024 convention.

Then, will "House of the Dragon" Season 2, Episode 7 (title TBA) receive an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, two days after its release? The resolution will be based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after the episode's release, specifically at noon PT. The rating must be a strict inequality greater than 8.5, using the precision listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal.

question.title: Conditional on Disney not announcing a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will 'House of the Dragon' S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Disney does not announce a new night time parade for Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World at or before D23 2024. This includes not announcing any new parade or moving an existing parade like the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night to Florida. This will be determined by the end of the convention or earlier if announced before.

Then, is the following true: "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 7 (title TBA) will have an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, two days after its release (July 30th), based on the score displayed at noon PT, using the precision listed by IMDB, which is typically a single decimal. This is a strict inequality, and the market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two separate political contexts: the U.S. presidential election and the Indian general election.

Condition: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024. This is based on the data reported by 538's national polling average as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indian National Congress (INC) has a member sworn in as the next Prime Minister of India following the next general elections, which are expected to occur in May 2024. If any other party forms the government, the question resolves as **No**.

If the condition regarding Trump's lead is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being ≤3 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden according to 538's national polling average is either less than or equal to 3 points, or greater than 4 points. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This will be determined based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead. 

Then, is the following statement true: The Indian National Congress (INC) has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected in May 2024. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the INC forms the government and has a member sworn in as Prime Minister following the next general election after June 1, 2022. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Conditional on Russian athletes being barred from the 2024 Olympics, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means that Russian athletes are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russians participating. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present or credible media reports. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. Also, if the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed, this condition is not met.

Given that condition, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This will resolve as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to credible reports. If it is not approved, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Russian athletes not being barred from the 2024 Olympics, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: More than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, as determined by the official list of countries and athletes present or credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded with Russian participation exceeding 34 athletes. Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources? If the condition about Russian athletes is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

question.title: Given a journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: A Slovak journalist or opposition politician is criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, as reported by credible Slovak media outlets, international news organizations, or relevant Slovak institutions, before June 15, 2024. Then, is it true that Israel will expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024, as reported by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) on its map at any of the six specified locations surrounding Rafah?

question.title: Conditional on no journalist and no opposition politician being charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, or relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect, before June 15, 2024.

Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Conditional on Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be between 76k and 77k?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000? This will be determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given Israel refrains from a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
