Suppose the following is true: Israel refrains from carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. This means that there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals during this period.

Then, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: If "deepfake" is said in the June 27, 2024 CNN debate, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators says "deepfake." This determination is made by Metaculus's Admins based on the broadcast and possibly CNN's official transcript.

Then, will the following be true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, thereby making the Vice President the Acting President? Note that the duration of incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Given neither Trump, Biden, nor a moderator says "deepfake" in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, neither Donald Trump, Joe Biden, nor any of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." This determination is made at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript. Then, is it true that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) will invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)? The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by other means does not count.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, one of these events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC); The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC; The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines; The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Then, will at least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved? The poll asks "has weak AGI been achieved" and does not define the term, allowing respondents to vote based on their own understanding. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th. This question will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Conditional on no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This means that none of the following events happen before that date: The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given this situation, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? The Manifold poll asks respondents if "weak AGI" has been achieved, allowing for personal interpretation of the term, and does not require the AI to manipulate the physical world. The poll results are considered only if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. If this condition is met, the question resolves to YES; otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: If the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election. This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that the United States Olympic Team will be the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will resolve positively if the US team tops the medal table, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Medals in that order.

question.title: Given the Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of political changes on sports outcomes. 

Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party loses Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election. This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person not representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024? This question resolves positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: If 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: At any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as indicated by the resolution source at https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. Then, is it true that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET? This will be based on the CDC's "epidemiological weeks" and the rate for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season is considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. Data will be considered after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will the peak hospitalization rate occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in 2023-24?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: The resolution source is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, the condition is true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

If the condition is not met, the resolution is N/A.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
This question combines two distinct forecasting questions:

1. Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump testifies, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This will resolve as YES if credible sources report his testimony at the specified trial.

2. Then, is the following true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

The conditional question asks whether the economic indicator (Core CPI) will show an increase under the condition that Donald Trump testifies at the specified trial.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not testifying at the hush money trial, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump does not testify, neither in person nor remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources.

Then, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, will the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and NO for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as YES. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is ≤3 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. Now, given this condition, will the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This will be determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the men's pole vault Olympic record be broken?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024. The event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves as Yes if any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

question.title: Given no terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Given the Prime Minister of France is from the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Given this condition, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: If the Prime Minister of France is not from the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Then, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No if he is not. The question is not restricted to the candidates currently known; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: If the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This means that after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? This resolves as YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is not attacked before July 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is not hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This means that after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? The resolution source for this is the New York Times interactive page on the 2024 US elections. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, this question resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will the party of the Prime Minister of France not be New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources?

question.title: Given Meta does not publish a report from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will the French Prime Minister not belong to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question is not concerned with who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely about who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and No for all other outcomes. In case of a tie in seats, both tied groups will resolve as Yes. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question explores a hypothetical scenario: Suppose Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the Republican nominee.

Given this scenario, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? The resolution criteria for the European Parliament question are as follows: It resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats. It resolves as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

The currency question resolves according to the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. Resolves YES if the USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on that date, and NO otherwise.

If the condition about Inflection is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection failing to publish a red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Inflection fails to publish a public report with results from an external red-teaming of their AI models for safety by June 30, 2024. Given this, will USD be worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if Inflection does not publish the specified report by June 30, 2024.
- The outcome resolves YES if the USD/JPY close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance, is greater than or equal to 145. Otherwise, it resolves NO.
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats or is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

2. After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The S&D does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as Yes if the S&D does not hold the most seats, and as No if they do hold the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, it resolves as No. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that the Crimean Bridge will be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This resolves as Yes if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Resolution criteria for "Trap": This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context for "Trap": "Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential diplomatic actions between the Philippines and China given the political scenario where Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Condition: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, any of the following events occur according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events happen by that date, it resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores whether diplomatic tensions will escalate between the Philippines and China under the condition that Will Hurd is not selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who else is selected; the question is solely about whether Will Hurd is the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, the question resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition in the 2024 European Parliament elections, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being ≤2 or >4 on July 15, 2024, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 2 points, or greater than 4 points, as reported on July 15, 2024. This is determined by accessing the 538 national polling average chart on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Given this condition, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance maintain its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections? This will resolve to "Yes" if Fidesz-KDNP secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Les Républicains form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access ChatGPT without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), and at least >50% of the population can use it. Also, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources? If such an agreement is announced, the answer is YES; if not, the answer is NO.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT not being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will the Republicans Party of France form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This means the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, and at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and this condition holds even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Given this condition, will the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election? This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party and National Rally for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
question.body:
This market resolves to YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.

This market will close when the Men's Olympic Road Race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

question.title: Given Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race, will Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. This race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m., and resolves YES if van der Poel ranks higher than van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, it resolves 50%/50%.

Given this condition, the question is whether Sha'Carri Richardson will win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. This resolves YES if she wins gold in any event. Track and field events run from August 1 to August 11, with Richardson competing in the Women's 100m on August 2-3 and potentially in the Women's 4x100m Relay on August 8-9.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Mathieu van der Poel must rank higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Sha'Carri Richardson must win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Given Mathieu van der Poel does not finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race, will Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
question.body:
This conditional question resolves based on two criteria:

1. Suppose the following is true: Mathieu van der Poel does not finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. This means that Mathieu van der Poel ranks lower than Wout van Aert, or if both do not finish, van der Poel gives up first, or if both give up due to the same crash or do not start, it resolves 50%/50%.

2. Then, is it true that Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games? This resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any event during the track and field competitions from August 1 to August 11, including the Women's 100m or Women's 4x100m Relay.

The question is interested in whether Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal, given the specified outcome of the Men's Olympic Road Race involving Mathieu van der Poel and Wout van Aert.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this condition, will "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 7, which is yet to be titled, have an IMDB rating greater than 8.5? The rating is determined 2 days after the episode's release, specifically at noon PT on July 30th. The rating is based on the score displayed by IMDB, using their typical precision of a single decimal, and must strictly exceed 8.5 for a YES resolution.

question.title: Conditional on Trump’s lead over Biden being ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB 2 days after release?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average, is less than or equal to 2 points, or greater than 3 points. This value is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024.

Now, based on this condition, consider the following outcome: Will "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 7 be rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release? The resolution of this question will be based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after the episode's release (July 30th), at noon PT, using the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality.

All relevant context and criteria for both the condition and the outcome have been provided.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy not being the Republican nominee, will Scotland hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected as the Republican nominee.

Then, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. The referendum must have the consent of the London government and cannot be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will be resolved NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as I can after the announcement).

question.title: Given Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024, will Silver close above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. This announcement must be for a new parade, not a relocation of an existing one, and must occur by the end of the convention. Then, is it true that the price of 1 ounce of silver will be above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024? The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below, the answer is NO. If it is above $30.50 USD, the answer is YES. The resolution will be based on the Kitco.com price at the specified time.

Then, will the price of 1 ounce of silver be above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, according to Kitco.com? question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Given the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results before August 12, will Joe Biden announce his resignation and withdrawal by end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024. 

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time? 

Resolution criteria: 
1. For the condition: Credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET, any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish.
2. For the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time. Otherwise, resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Given the Venezuelan electoral commission fails to publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, will Joe Biden announce he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Venezuelan electoral commission fails to publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024. This means that credible sources report that no Venezuelan government entity has published results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish, by August 12, 2024, 12:01 AM VET.

Then is the following true? Joe Biden announces, before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time, that he is both dropping out of the re-election race and resigning from the presidency. The announcement must occur before the end of July, but formal resignation is not required by that date. If Joe Biden makes such an announcement, this resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher year-over-year on July 20, 2024, will UCLA hold its in-person graduation ceremonies on June 14, 2024?
question.body: This question considers the impact of financial market conditions on university operations. Suppose the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS). Given this condition, will the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies as scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion at 11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM? All ceremonies must occur at the specified location and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled time. The question resolves as **Yes** if all ceremonies occur as specified and **No** if any ceremony does not meet these criteria, including being moved, delayed, or held online.

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is lower or the same Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will UCLA hold its in-person graduation ceremonies on June 14, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is lower or the same on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed. This means that the reported number for July 20, 2024, must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Given this condition, will UCLA hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 as scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion, starting within 1 hour of their scheduled times at 11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM? The ceremonies must occur at the specified locations and times, and not be moved online or to another location. If any ceremony does not meet these criteria, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

question.title: If the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?

Then, will the BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which is expected to occur in May 2024. All other outcomes resolve as **No**.

The question resolves as N/A if the condition about the 2024 Olympics is not met.

question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, there are no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China. This means that none of the following events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given this condition, will OpenAI publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? The question resolves as YES if such a report is published by the specified date.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves NO if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Conditional on the US failing to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that either the men's or women's basketball team places anywhere other than gold, leading to a YES resolution for this condition. Given this, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 (ET), and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Given USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they top the medal table with no other team achieving a higher or equal ranking. The medal table ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals to break ties. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, this condition is ambiguous.

Given this condition, will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals? This resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves as **No** if any other team wins the NBA Finals.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.
