question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on less than 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by a monthly poll conducted by Manifold, which asks participants if weak AGI has been achieved, without providing a specific definition of AGI. The poll results will be considered as YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) responses is less than 0.3 in the July 2024 poll.

Given this condition, we want to know if at least 20 House/Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early. The context is that dozens of House Democrats are organizing to speak out against the Democratic National Committee's effort to secure Biden's nomination sooner than planned, arguing it stifles debate. A public letter, or multiple letters with a combined total, signed by at least 20 Democratic lawmakers by the end of Sunday, July 21st, would resolve this question to YES. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest R-rated opening weekend?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?

Resolution criteria for Liz Cheney's nomination: Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

Resolution criteria for "Deadpool x Wolverine" opening weekend: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on Liz Cheney not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question explores two separate events and combines them into a conditional forecast. 

Condition: Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as YES if any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Outcome: The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected for a record-breaking opening weekend. This question resolves as YES if the movie grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend, as reported by the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication), marking it as the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. 

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
This conditional question explores the relationship between two separate events:

1. **Condition:** On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's. This is determined by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. **Outcome of Interest:** A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden.

For the outcome to resolve YES, all five individuals must be part of the same group message, and their names must be publicly known before the market's end date. Separate individual statements or unnamed reports do not meet the criteria. In ambiguous cases, the market errs towards resolving NO.

Suppose the condition regarding Nvidia's market cap is true. Then, is the outcome regarding Democratic pressure on Biden also true?

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap not being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed democrats writing to Biden asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, the market resolves NO.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Conditional on a geomagnetic storm with K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6 occurring, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

Additionally, the question resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

If the condition regarding the geomagnetic storm is not met, the resolution is N/A.

question.title: GIVEN the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index <= 4 or > 6, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 4 or greater than 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

Then, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will the Denver Nuggets win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Denver Nuggets are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Given the Denver Nuggets win the 2024 NBA Finals, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Denver Nuggets are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Resolves "No" otherwise. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Given that the Denver Nuggets do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Denver Nuggets are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as Yes if the Denver Nuggets are not crowned the champions. Resolves as No if they are crowned the champions.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves to Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the IOC or other credible sources. Resolves to No otherwise. If confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, resolves to Yes immediately.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on the ID political group holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that the INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024? This will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Given the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as Yes if the ID political group does not hold the most seats, and No if they do hold the most seats or are tied for the most seats, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that the INC will form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024? This resolves as Yes if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, and No otherwise. This is for the general election occurring after June 1, 2022, expected in May 2024.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is the following true? The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as Yes if S&D holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given no terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

An event counts as a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. Then, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as Yes if the S&D holds the most seats, including ties, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Conditional on Rishi Sunak failing to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. This condition resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency, the condition resolves as **No**.

Given this condition, the outcome we are interested in is whether Joe Biden will die before Saturday. This outcome resolves as **Yes** if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Rishi Sunak being elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
This question considers the scenario where Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. If this condition is met, we then ask whether Joe Biden will die before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Resolves YES if Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: If "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic opening exceeds combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will the Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question is conditional on the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" being higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). The opening figures are reported by Boxofficemojo.

If this condition is met, then the question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

If the condition about the box office is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on "Deadpool & Wolverine" opening less than or equal to "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between the box office performance of a major film and the success of an NBA team. 

Criterion for condition: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" must be less than or equal to $185,548,391, the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), as reported by Boxofficemojo.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves NO if they are eliminated from contention or another team wins.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
He has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score?

Will resolve YES if he scores according to https://www.uefa.com/euro2024/statistics/players/goals/ *

Will resolve NO if he doesn't. 

*Penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs are not counted towards goals scored by individual players in their goal records. Own goals also do not count. 

[link preview]

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where a single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. The sports considered are association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If the same NOC wins at least two of these events, the condition is met.

Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves YES if the same NOC wins gold in more than one of the specified women's team sports. Resolves NO if women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these events.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024, according to official UEFA statistics. Resolves NO if he does not score. Note that penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs and own goals do not count towards his goal tally.

If the condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means that women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOCs) win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given this scenario, will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: The question about the Olympics resolves as Yes if women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in the specified sports. It resolves as No otherwise.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

question.title: Conditional on Paris Saint-Germain winning the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Paris Saint-Germain wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League by winning the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Given this condition, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics? The question resolves as YES if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Paris Saint-Germain not winning the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
The question about Paris Saint-Germain resolves "Yes" if they do not win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

The question about the Paris Olympics resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

The conditional question asks: Suppose Paris Saint-Germain does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League. Then, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Given a Trump family member is the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A member of the Trump family becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Then, is it true that diplomatic expulsions or recalls will take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if one of the aforementioned individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events happen before the date, the outcome resolves No.

question.title: Given no member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for US Presidency in 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No member of the Trump family, including Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, and Barron Trump, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria: This resolves as Yes if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following events occur according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, this resolves as No. This question follows the same resolution criteria as the original question on Metaculus.

question.title: Will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

"Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.

Here's a list of CinemaScores for previous video game adaptations.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record, will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, as verified by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Then, will the movie "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves Yes if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher. It resolves No if it receives a C+ or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Given the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 does NOT break the Olympic record, will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events: the performance in the men's 100m dash at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics and the reception of the movie "Borderlands" (2024).

Condition: The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 does NOT break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds. This condition resolves as **Yes** if no athlete runs the race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to official results from the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

Outcome: "Borderlands" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B- or above. This resolves as **Yes** if the movie receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and **No** if it receives a C+ or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves as N/A.

Suppose the condition regarding the Olympic record is true. Then, is the outcome regarding the CinemaScore of "Borderlands" true?

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. The condition resolves as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes, including ties. Official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports will be used for resolution.

Given this condition, the outcome in question is whether Biden will remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves as **Yes** if Biden remains President through this period and as **No** if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect a **Yes** resolution, as Acting President is distinct from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Given ECR does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions. 

First, suppose the following is true: ECR does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if ECR does not hold the most seats and as **No** if ECR holds the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, given this condition, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024; it resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" has a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). This is determined by Boxofficemojo and resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

Then, is it true that the United States Olympic Team will win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics? This resolves Yes if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic box office opening is lower than or equal to "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is lower than or equal to $185,548,391, the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013). Resolution criteria for this are based on Boxofficemojo's report on the movie's page.

Then, is the following true? The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This resolves Yes if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, according to any of the categories indicating Russian control such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Conditional on Russia not having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any categories indicating Russian control, such as assessed Russian advance, gains, or claimed territory. Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?

Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body:
This question considers the impact of international trade policies on political stability. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The EU must announce new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this resolution.

question.title: Given the EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports that the European Union (EU) has announced any new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports of new EU tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a NO resolution.
